prelude.name: Bradyn Glines
prelude.tagline: My 10+ years of web development and programming experience has led me to work on a lot of different types of projects solving a multitude of different problems.

entries.heading: Fabric Health, New York, NY
entries.title: Senior Software Engineer
entries.summary: After an aquisition from Florence from Bright Health Group (now called Fabric Health), I continued working on internal and external APIs for other internal applications as well as third-party API consumers, in house gems, the front-end Angular.js application and helping teammates by being a go-to technical resource as well as making myself avaialble for pairing sessions.

entries.heading: Bright Health Group, Minneapolis, MN
entries.title: Senior Engineer 3
entries.summary: When hired, my main role was to support the company’s telehealth service web application (RoR) by helping to develop a localization (I18n) solution. I was quickly pulled in to work on maintaining and providing new features for in-house gems and other internal APIs. Shortly after, I was looked at as a technical resource and “go-to” team member to help diagnose application issues or when planning, designing and developing new application features as our team's feature lead.

entries.heading: Bendyworks, Madison, WI
entries.title: Senior Software Developer
entries.summary: Working in technologies like Ruby on Rails and various different JavaScript frameworks, I helped teams as a consultant to implement their ideas as well as build up their knowledge of software development and code design. I had the opportunity to work with small buisnesses as well as companies like ZenDesk and Disney.

entries.heading: Wellbe, Madison, WI
entries.title: Full Stack Web Developer
entries.summary: Hired as a full stack web developer working both in Ruby on Rails and the front-end, I quickly found the front-end lacking modern tooling and revamped it with interesting technologies like React and StencilJS. I brought high reusability to the front-end by building a modularized Web Components based architecture to bring scalability, composability, reusability, and quick iteration.

entries.heading: Hotel MSSNGR, Berlin, Germany
entries.title: Software Developer
entries.summary: My role was to support the company’s main website written in Ruby on Rails, an API written with Sinatra and support the company’s other 3rd party development groups using our APIs to develop their mobile applications.

entries.heading: 4Life Research, Sandy, UT
entries.title: Software Developer
entries.summary: I was responsible for assisting the front-end development team with what they needed from the back end. I was also responsible for interfacing with the architecture team to help design APIs of in-house software libraries that would be consumed in the .NET MVC project and integrating those libraries.

entries.heading: CrowdEngine
entries.title: Customer Support / Front End Developer
entries.summary: My responsibilities ranged from assisting new and existing customers by answering questions about the platform and customizing their personal websites on the platform and collaborating with backend developers.
